page.title: 19THE HOLNICOTE ESTATE
page.content: Much of this block lies within the Holnicote Estate,most of which was given to the{National Trust}by Sir Richard Dyke Acland in 1944.The estate covers an area of about 20 square miles on the N.E. edge of Exmoor and within the National Park.The estate is administered from Holnicote,once an Acland home,although Holnicote House itself is used as a country holiday centre by the{Holiday Fellowship.}Half the estate is unenclosed moor and hill and of the rest a third is woodland and two thirds farmland.The National Trust pursues a{management policy} which balances{conservation}with the needs of farm tenants and of visitors. There is Trust Information Centre and Shop at Selworthy and a Caravan and Tent Site at Horner.
